oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Copy print photograph showing the DuPont Plant from the 1928 bridge
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph was taken sometime after 1928 and shows the DuPont Plant in the right background. The 1928 bridge crossed the Cumberland River and connected Hadley's Bend (Old Hickory) with Madison, Tennessee. Prior to this bridge, access across the Cumberland River was via a swinging bridge that traversed the river at Edenwold. The 1928 bridge was dedicated as a memorial to veterans of World War I. The DuPont Powder Works occupied most of Hadley's Bend and was constructed from 1917 to 1918.
